description:
# Attack System

This extension includes several behaviors which work together create a complete attack system with both ranged and melee weapons. The behaviors are Attack, HandheldItem, SwingingItem, Target, and HealthBar.

## Attack Behavior Setup

There will typically be at least two objects: the Attacker and the Target. To set them up:
1. Add the Attack behavior to the Attacker.
2. Add the Target behavior to the Target.
3. On each frame, use the "Check for damage" action to check if the Target is being damaged by a weapon or projectile.
4. Use the "Attack by..." actions to attack, either by swinging or by firing (or both, or neither).
    - The action can be invoked in response to a specific event, like a key press, or it can be run on every frame to auto-attack.

The attack damage, interval, range, and direction can be configured in the Attack behavior properties. The Attack behavior also maintains a kill count for the attacker. The Target behavior keeps track of damage done and the death count for the target.

## Swinging Behaviors

This also includes behaviors which allow an object to be held and swung like a sword. There are two behaviors which tend to go together, although they could be used separately (e.g. a non-swinging item, like a key).

1. HandheldItem: An item with this behavior can be held by another object at a named point.
    - For the object holding the item, create a custom point or move the "Center" or "Origin" points to wherever the item should be held by the object (the "hand") . 
    - For the item being held, move the "Center" point to wherever it should be held (like the hilt of a sword).
2. SwingingItem: An object in this behavior can be swung like a sword.
    - You can configure the starting angle, swing speed and swing arc length.
    - The swing can follow the rotation of the object holding the item.

# Health Bar
This extension also includes a behavior for a health bar which can hover above a shape painter object and change in response to the damage done to the Target. To use the health bar:
1. Add the HealthBar behavior to the Target.
2. Attach the health bar to the object using the "Attach health bar" action.
3. Update the health bar every frame using the "Update health bar" action.
name: Attack
shortDescription: Have an object attack and do damage to another object using an optional melee or a ranged weapon.

eventsFunctions.description: Create a health bar and attach it to an object.
eventsFunctions.name: AttachHealthBar

parameters.description: Character to attach the health bar to
parameters.name: Character

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: An object which can attack a target with a ranged or melee weapon.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Attack

eventsFunctions.description: Attack a target.
eventsFunctions.name: Attack

parameters.longDescription:
This controls whether the object attacks always, whenever it is ready, even when not in range of the target.  
If the attack is triggered for specific events, like a key release, then this should probably be set to "Yes".  
If the attack is run on every frame to have the character auto-attack, then this should probably be set to "No".
parameters.name: AttackAlways

eventsFunctions.description: Attack a target by swinging a melee weapon.
eventsFunctions.name: AttackSwing
eventsFunctions.sentence: Have _PARAM0_ attack _PARAM2_ by swinging weapon _PARAM4_ (always swing when ready _PARAM6_)

parameters.longDescription:
This controls whether the object swings the weapon always, whenever it is ready, even when not in range of the target.  
If the attack is triggered for specific events, like a key release, then this should probably be set to "Yes".  
If the attack is run on every frame to have the character auto-attack, then this should probably be set to "No".
parameters.name: SwingAlways

eventsFunctions.description: Attack a target by firing a weapon using a projectile.
eventsFunctions.name: AttackFire
eventsFunctions.sentence: Have _PARAM0_ attack _PARAM2_ by firing from point _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_ using projectile _PARAM6_ (always fire when ready _PARAM7_, auto-aim _PARAM8_)

parameters.longDescription:
This controls whether the object fires the weapon always, whenever it is ready, even when not in range of the target.  
If the attack is triggered for specific events, like a key release, then this should typically be set to "Yes".  
If the attack is run on every frame to have the character auto-attack, then this should typically be set to "No".
parameters.name: FireAlways

parameters.longDescription:
This controls whether the object automatically aims the weapon to fire at the target when it is in range.  
When this is set to "No", the attacker will fire in the attack direction.  
When set to "Yes", the attacker will fire directly at the target, but only when they are in range.
parameters.name: AutoAim

eventsFunctions.description: Attack a target by swinging and firing a weapon with a projectile.
eventsFunctions.name: AttackFireSwing
eventsFunctions.sentence: Have _PARAM0_ attack _PARAM2_ by swinging _PARAM4_ and firing from point _PARAM6_;_PARAM7_ using projectile _PARAM8_ (always fire when ready _PARAM9_, auto-aim _PARAM10_)

parameters.description: X position of the point to fire from
parameters.name: PointX

parameters.description: Y position of the point to fire from
parameters.name: PointY

parameters.longDescription:
This controls whether the object fires the weapon always, whenever it is ready, even when not in range of the target.  
If the attack is triggered for specific events, like a key release, then this should typically be set to "Yes".  
If the attack is run on every frame to have the character auto-attack, then this should typically be set to "No".
parameters.name: FireAlways

parameters.longDescription:
This controls whether the object automatically aims the weapon to fire at the target when it is in range.  
When this is set to "No", the attacker will fire in the attack direction.  
When set to "Yes", the attacker will fire directly at the target, but only when they are in range.
parameters.name: AutoAim

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is damaging the target.
eventsFunctions.name: CheckDamage
eventsFunctions.sentence: Check if _PARAM0_ is damaging _PARAM2_ with _PARAM4_ (weapon is projectile _PARAM5_)

eventsFunctions.description: Set the damage done by the attack.
eventsFunctions.name: SetAttackDamage

eventsFunctions.description: Get the damage done by the attack.
eventsFunctions.name: AttackDamage

eventsFunctions.description: Set the direction of the attack relative to the character (Left, Right, Up or Down).
eventsFunctions.name: SetAttackDirection

parameters.longDescription: The direction of the attack relative to the character, which is either Left, Right, Up, or Down
parameters.name: Direction

eventsFunctions.description: Get the direction of the attack relative to the character (Left, Right, Up or Down).
eventsFunctions.name: AttackDirection

eventsFunctions.description: Get the kill count for the object.
eventsFunctions.name: KillCount

eventsFunctions.description: Resets the kill count.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetCount

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object has just attacked.
eventsFunctions.name: HasJustAttacked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is ready to attack.
eventsFunctions.name: IsReadyToAttack

eventsFunctions.description: Check that the target is in range and that the object is facing the target.
eventsFunctions.name: IsInRange

eventsFunctions.description: Fire a weapon with a projectile in a direction (Left, Right, Up, or Down).
eventsFunctions.name: FireInDirection
eventsFunctions.sentence: Have _PARAM0_ fire from _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_ with projectile _PARAM4_ in direction _PARAM5_

eventsFunctions.description: Fire a weapon with a projectile at a target.
eventsFunctions.name: FireAtTarget
eventsFunctions.sentence: Have _PARAM0_ fire from _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_ with projectile _PARAM4_ at target _PARAM5_

eventsFunctions.description: Fire a projectile toward a position.
eventsFunctions.name: FireTowardPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_, toward position _PARAM5_;_PARAM6_

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

eventsFunctions.description: Fire a projectile.
eventsFunctions.name: Fire
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_, with angle _PARAM5_

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Angle of the bullet, in degrees
parameters.name: Angle

propertyDescriptors.label: How often to attack, in seconds
propertyDescriptors.name: AttackInterval

propertyDescriptors.label: The direction of the attack relative to the character (Left, Right, Up, or Down)
propertyDescriptors.name: AttackDirection

propertyDescriptors.label: Speed of the firing attack, in pixels per second
propertyDescriptors.name: AttackSpeed

propertyDescriptors.label: Rotate object to face in the attack direction
propertyDescriptors.name: RotateDirection

propertyDescriptors.label: Flip object to face in the attack direction
propertyDescriptors.name: FlipDirection

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: An item that can be held by another object at a specific point.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: HandheldItem

eventsFunctions.description: Pick up the item by another object at the specified point.
eventsFunctions.name: PickUp

parameters.longDescription: The name of the point on the holding object where the item is held ("Origin", "Center", or a custom point name).
parameters.name: Point

eventsFunctions.description: Put down the item.
eventsFunctions.name: PutDown

propertyDescriptors.label: Follow the rotation of the holding object
propertyDescriptors.name: FollowRotation

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: An item that can swing in an arc from a starting angle, like a sword.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SwingingItem

eventsFunctions.description: Swing the item in an arc from the starting angle.
eventsFunctions.name: SwingItem

propertyDescriptors.label: Total degrees in the swing's arc
propertyDescriptors.name: SwingArc

propertyDescriptors.label: Swing speed, in degrees per frame. Can be negative to swing in the opposite direction.
propertyDescriptors.name: SwingSpeed

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Paints a health bar which can optionally follow above a character.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: HealthBar

eventsFunctions.description: Update the health bar display based on the health of the character.
eventsFunctions.name: Update

propertyDescriptors.label: Float the health bar above the character
propertyDescriptors.name: FloatAbove

propertyDescriptors.label: Height above the center of the character to float the health bar
propertyDescriptors.name: FloatHeight

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: An object which can be the target of an attack.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Target

eventsFunctions.description: Damage the target.
eventsFunctions.name: DamageTarget

eventsFunctions.description: Get the damage done to the target.
eventsFunctions.name: DamageDone

eventsFunctions.description: Get maximum damage until target is dead.
eventsFunctions.name: MaximumDamage

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the target is dead.
eventsFunctions.name: IsDead

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the target has recently been damaged.
eventsFunctions.name: IsJustDamaged

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the damage done to the target.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetDamage

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the death count.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetCount

eventsFunctions.description: Get the death count for the object.
eventsFunctions.name: DeathCount

propertyDescriptors.label: Maximum damage until target is dead
propertyDescriptors.name: MaximumDamage
